Vi söker en serviceinriktad IT Supporttekniker som vill bli en del av vår kunds härliga och kunniga servicedesk. Hos oss får du arbeta i ett innovativt bolag i framkant, där du hjälper kunder och användare med tekniska frågor, felsökning och support i en modern IT-miljö.

  

I rollen som IT Supporttekniker är du en problemlösare med varierande arbetsuppgifter och utmaningar. Du har möjlighet att få djupare insyn i olika IT-miljöer och hitta lösningar på mer komplexa IT-problem. Du kommer att ansvara för felsökning av både hård- och mjukvara samt hantering av inkommande ärenden via telefon, e-post och ärendehanteringssystem. Du arbetar i en Windows-miljö med Microsoft 365 och sköter kontoadministration i Active Directory och Azure/Entra ID.

**Ansvarsområden:**

* Ta emot ärenden från deras kunds användare och ge ett bra bemötande.
* Hantering av klientdatorer, servrar och mobiltelefoner.
* Windows-miljö, Microsoft 365 och tillhörande företagsapplikationer samt administration i Active Directory.
* Följa upp och slutföra deras användares ärenden med fokus på kundnöjdhet.
* Identifiera och rapportera återkommande problem inom deras supportleverans.

**För att du ska trivas i rollen** som IT Supporttekniker hos oss ser vi att du är serviceinriktad, noggrann och stresstålig. Du är en lagspelare som gillar att jobba i grupp. Du trivs i en miljö där man delar kunskap med varandra och ligger i framkant vad beträffar tjänster och teknik.

**Vad vi söker hos dig:**

* Stort intresse inom IT
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av kundtjänst eller teknisk support
* Kunskap inom exempelvis Microsoft 365, nätverk, Windows Server och hårdvara
* Flytande i både finska, svenska och engelska i tal och skrift

 **Start**: Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare

 **Placeringsort:** Stockholm

**Ansökan:** Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match

 **Vad vi står för:**  

Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.


Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!

 **Varför ska du välja oss?**  

Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.

 *Vill du vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt?*

title: Backend Programmer with Golang experience
description:
### **Mission brief**


You will help design, develop, and ship robust backend services and web interfaces. The work centres on Golang-based systems connected to internal tools, user-facing dashboards, and scalable APIs. Inspired by our internal reference engineer (with a background in distributed systems, data pipelines, and modern frontend development), the ideal candidate is comfortable moving between backend architecture and polished web output.


Core responsibilities include:  

* Designing and implementing backend services in **Golang**, with clean, testable, and maintainable code.
* Matchmaking for multiplayer shooter
* Building web interfaces and tooling that connect seamlessly to backend systems.
* Developing APIs, integrating external services, and ensuring stable data flows.
* Ensuring performance, reliability, and security across the stack.
* Debugging, testing, and improving existing services.
* Collaborating closely with designers and other engineers to deliver intuitive user experiences.
* Contributing to architectural discussions and proposing improvements.

### **Details**


Start date: Flexible (as early as possible)  

Occupancy rate: **Full-time (100%)**  

Level: **Mid–Senior**  

Work setup: **Stockholm** on-site  

  

**Your player profile**

* Proven experience as a **Backend Programmer** with a strong foundation in **Golang** and modern web technologies.
* Experience building distributed services, APIs, and scalable backend components.
* Solid understanding of JavaScript/TypeScript and at least one modern web framework.
* Familiarity with relational and/or NoSQL databases, querying, and data modeling.
* Experience integrating external systems and working with containerized environments.
* Awareness of web security, authentication, and best practices for production systems.

**Bonus points for:**  

* Experience with cloud environments (GCP, AWS, or similar).
* Knowledge of performance optimization in high-throughput systems.
* An interest in developer tooling or internal platforms.
* Experience with multiplayer games
* Experience with shooter games

title: Technical Support Expert
description:
**This is Worldline** 




 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




 The Technical Support Team is one of the key functions within our organization. As a Technical Support Expert, you’ll be one of the main, and most important, contact points for our merchants in need of support. You love to help people, communicate, analyze, and troubleshoot the payment product we offer.
 



  





 You’ll be supporting the clients in their questions regarding PaymentIQ service, which is a fast, dynamic, complex, and powerful platform, with a vast number of integrations towards systems, payment methods and special setups. The complex and customizable nature of the system makes it technically demanding yet rewarding to be supporting.
 



  





**Day-to-Day Responsibilities** 



* Monitor ticket queues to resolve issues, receive and reply to support requests through Helpdesk application and telephone.
* Provide timely response, meeting defined service level agreements and internal support KPI and ensuring resolution to all reported issues



  





**Who Are We Looking For** 




 People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:
 


* You are customer focused and service minded with a great interest and understanding in technology
* Solution-driven with a strong analytical ability
* Love to communicate
* Takes ownership and responsibility for tasks you are assigned
* Truly flexible; able to shift tasks and priorities in a big way at the drop of a hat
* Strong customer service skills
* Previous experience as a Technical Support Agent both onsite and/or remote
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken
* Interest in, or knowledge in programming (Java, SQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Eclipse or Git) is an advantage
* Previous experience of the payment industry is an advantage



  





**Perks & Benefits** 




 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
 


* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.



  





**Shape the evolution** 




 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
 



  





 Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com
 



  





 We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: IT System Administrator
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**Our Core Tech Stack**
 You'll work hands-on with a modern, integrated technology ecosystem designed for security, productivity, and collaboration. Our identity management foundation centers on Okta for access control and Entra ID for hybrid directory services. Daily productivity flows through Google Workspace for collaboration and Slack for team communication, while Zoom handles video conferencing needs.
   

  

 IT operations are streamlined with Workwize for asset management, and we leverage AI assistance through ChatGPT and Claude to enhance workflow efficiency. This stack supports our fast-paced environment while maintaining enterprise-grade security and scalability as we continue to grow.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Identity & Access Management - Administer and evolve our Okta environment including SSO integrations (SAML 2.0 & OIDC), lifecycle management, MFA policies, and Okta Workflows. Manage Entra ID for hybrid identity scenarios and conditional access policies.
* User Provisioning & Deprovisioning - Implement and maintain SCIM-based automated provisioning across SaaS applications. Own the full employee lifecycle from onboarding to offboarding, ensuring timely access grants and revocations.
* Google Workspace Administration - Manage Google Workspace at scale, including user and group management, email routing and DNS records (SPF, DKIM, DMARC), shared drives, security policies, and organizational unit configuration.
* SaaS Management - Administer and optimise Slack, Zoom, Workwize, and other business-critical SaaS tools. Manage licenses, configurations, and integrations to support company growth.
* Apple Device Management - Own the full device lifecycle for macOS and iOS using an MDM platform (e.g. Kandji, Jamf). Handle Apple Business Manager, zero-touch deployment, OS patching, and endpoint security.
* Automation & Integration - Build automations and integrations across platforms using APIs, scripting (Python, Bash), and workflow tools. Reduce manual toil and improve operational efficiency.
* Security & Compliance - Collaborate with the Security team to implement Zero Trust principles, enforce conditional access policies, and maintain compliance controls aligned with frameworks such as ISO 27001, SOC 2, and GDPR.
* Office IT & Infrastructure - Manage on-site infrastructure including Wi-Fi networks, conference room AV, and hardware provisioning. Plan and execute IT setup for new office locations.
* Technical Support - Provide responsive, high-quality technical support and guidance to employees across all applications, devices, and services.


**Who You Are**
* 5+ years of experience in IT administration, systems operations, or a similar role in a fast-paced technology environment.
* Identity & SSO expertise - Deep hands-on experience with Okta (or comparable IdP), including SAML 2.0, OIDC, SCIM provisioning, lifecycle management, and MFA policies.
* Directory services - Familiarity with Entra ID (Azure AD) for hybrid identity, conditional access, and directory synchronisation.
* Google Workspace power user - Strong knowledge of admin console management, email authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC), DNS configuration, and org-level security policies.
* Apple ecosystem - Deep expertise in macOS and iOS administration, Apple Business Manager, and MDM tools such as Kandji, Jamf, or Intune.
* Scripting & APIs - Hands-on experience writing automation with Python, Bash, or PowerShell and integrating systems via REST APIs.
* Networking fundamentals - Solid understanding of DNS, DHCP, TLS/SSL, email routing, and general network troubleshooting.
* Familiarity with compliance frameworks (ISO 27001, SOC 2, GDPR) and how IT operations support them.
* Strong problem-solving mindset with a focus on automation, efficiency, and user experience.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to build trust as a reliable point of contact across the organisation.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Head of Application Engineering & Integration Division - based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support. The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Information Systems Directorate (IS), Business Technology Solutions Department\* (BTS), Application Engineering & Integration Division\* (AEI) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **Head of Application Engineering & Integration Division** 
 \*\*.
   

  

**This is a full-time position at grade 7 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* new name following Directorate reorganisation effective from March 2026
* internal benchmark Division Head IT Applications


***Applicants will receive initial feedback in February/March 2026***
***Assessment Centres for selected applicants would take place in March 2026***
***Panel interviews are anticipated for April 2026***
 Purpose
   

  

 You will take charge of our application engineering and integration capabilities, driving the platforms and practices that power the Bank’s digital transformation. You will also be in charge of a portfolio of bespoke business applications, ensuring they are engineered, maintained, and evolved in line with strategic, technical, and business expectations. You will unite integration operations, engineering enablement, innovation, and bespoke development under one vision, enabling impactful engineering solutions that accelerate the Bank’s digital journey.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report to the Head of the Business Solutions Department and work closely with the other Heads of Divisions of the Directorate, as well as with business users who participate in projects and initiatives led by the Division.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Define and drive the Bank’s application engineering and integration strategy to support IT and digital transformation.
* Govern, together with EA, Bank‑wide engineering standards and best practices across all application technologies.
* Lead the development and continuous improvement of secure, scalable, and cost‑effective integration platforms.
* Build and run an engineering enablement function that provides frameworks, tools, and expert support.
* Ensure engineering standards are applied in practice by overseeing key bespoke or strategic developments.
* Ensure security, resilience, and risk mitigation across all application engineering and integration activities
* Monitor and manage projects and programmes to deliver expected benefits on time and within budget.
* Propose and maintain an effective structure, operating model, and performance framework for the Division.
* Recruit and develop skilled staff while fostering an inclusive, high‑performance engineering culture.
* Optimise technology and vendor landscapes to ensure value, compliance, and strong performance.
* Ensure reliable day‑to‑day services by promoting automation and DevSecOps across the application lifecycle.
* Represent the Division in cross‑functional initiatives to embed engineering, integration, and innovation perspectives.
* Track technology trends and scale relevant innovations to keep the Bank aligned with industry best practice.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer sciences, software engineering, information technology, or a closely related discipline.
* At least 10 years of progressive professional experience in application engineering, enterprise integration, or software development within large and complex IT environments, ideally in regulated or financial institutions.
* Experience in or proven ability for managing and coaching people ideally in multicultural environments or international organisations (e.g. contribution to: deciding on team resources and skills; establishing objectives; assessing performance; delegating and supervising tasks; guiding, motivating, coaching and providing feedback)
* Proven experience in defining and rolling out engineering standards, guidelines, and enablement frameworks across multiple application domains and technologies.
* Demonstrated experience in managing large-scale programmes, platforms, or portfolios covering application development, integration solutions, and shared engineering services.
* Extensive knowledge of modern application engineering and integration architectures, including APIs, event-driven and service-oriented architectures, middleware platforms, cloud and hybrid environments, and enterprise integration patterns.
* Strong expertise in software engineering best practices, including DevSecOps, CI/CD pipelines, automation, code quality, testing strategies, and lifecycle management across heterogeneous technology stacks would be an advantage.
* Proven experience in engineering enablement and innovation, including the definition of reference architectures, reusable frameworks, accelerators, and developer tooling across key technologies used by the Bank would be ideal.
* Excellent knowledge of English. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage\*\*\*.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core and managerial competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 Deadline for applications:
 **16th February 2026**

title: Information Manager
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*
 Din roll
   

  

 Vill du vara med och skapa struktur, tydlighet och ordning i en växande organisation? Brinner du för att omsätta komplex information till smarta, säkra och användbara lösningar? Då kan du vara den Information Manager vi söker.
   

  

 Som Information Manager ansvarar du för att utveckla, förvalta och kvalitetssäkra vår informationshantering. Du blir en nyckelperson i arbetet med att skapa effektiva informationsflöden, säkra regelefterlevnad och stödja oss i vår tillväxt resa. Rollen är både strategisk och operativ – du växlar mellan att driva långsiktiga initiativ och att stödja verksamheten i det dagliga informationsarbetet.
   

  

 I rollen bidrar du också till utvecklingen av våra arbetssätt och IT-miljöer och säkerställer att verksamheten kan växa på ett tryggt och framtidssäkert sätt. Vår organisation regleras av flera regelverk, inklusive standarder för informationshantering och informationsklassificering (försvarssekretess, företagssekretess, exportkontroll). För att säkerställa efterlevnad använder vi olika IT-verktyg och nätverksmiljöer. En viktig uppgift är att leda organisationen i att inventera och strukturera tillgänglig information för att på ett effektivt sätt bidra i förändringsprojekt med fokus på säker informationshantering.
   

  

 Övergripande arbetsbeskrivning:
   

  

* Du ansvarar för helheten i vår informationshantering och agerar BA:s kontaktpunkt gentemot Saab Group och Surveillance BU:s. Du leder arbetet med att utveckla, strukturera och framtidssäkra informationsmiljön i hela affärsområdet.
* Supporterar och koordinerar med relevanta discipliner så som Informationssäkerhet.
* Du kartlägger informationsflöden och IT-miljöer och skapar förutsättningar för datadrivna arbetssätt, generativ AI och moderna utvecklingsmiljöer.
* Du identifierar förbättringsområden, fångar behov från verksamheten och driver initiativ som stärker informationsstrukturen, säkerheten och våra arbetssätt.
* Du stödjer projekt, program och team med metoder, rådgivning och utbildning inom informationshantering och informationssäkerhet, samt deltar i styrgrupper när det behövs.
* Du representerar BA:t i Process, Methods and Tools Community för Information Management och säkerställer att strategiska riktlinjer omsätts i praktiken.
* Du driver medvetenhet och kommunikation kring informationssäkerhet och informationsflöden för att skapa samsyn och förändringskraft i BA:t.


 Tjänsteort Stockholm, Göteborg eller Linköping.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 Vi söker en relationsbyggande ledare med god kommunikationsförmåga. Som person tror vi att du är handlingskraftig, drivs av förändring och förbättring, och sporras av tekniska utmaningar. Du är social och trivs i team, vilket gör att du effektivt kan bygga starka relationer och nätverk inom och utanför verksamheten. Integritet, lyhördhet och respekt för egna och andras expertområden är självklara egenskaper. Du har förmågan att arbeta operativt i detaljer och samtidigt hålla ett strategiskt helhetsperspektiv.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har följande kunskaper och förmågor:
   

  

* Relevant universitetsutbildning inom exempelvis IT, systemvetenskap, information management eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Förståelse för IT-strukturer, systemintegration, databaser och molnlösningar
* Arbetat med informationsarkitektur och informationslivscykelhantering.
* Förmåga att strukturera, klassificera och organisera information
* Kunskap om metadata, taxonomier och ontologier
* Förmåga att se samband i komplexa strukturer och informationsflöden, både på övergripande nivå och i detaljer som påverkar helhetsbilden.
* Arbetat med rutiner för datakvalitet, spårbarhet, regelefterlevnad, riskanalyser och klassificering av information
* Grundläggande kunskap om standarder som ISO27001, ISO9001 och liknande
* Självledarskap och förmåga att organisera eget arbete
* God språkkänsla på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Meriterande kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Förståelse för informationsklassificering inom försvarsindustrin.
* Erfarenhet av produktutveckling inom försvarsindustrin.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. Passion, nyfikenhet och ett starkt intresse för informationshantering och informationssäkerhet är viktiga drivkrafter i rollen. Din motivation och engagemang för området kan väga lika mycket som formella meriter.
   

  

*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*
 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.

title: Experienced Cloud Strategy & Architecture Leader
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax, and related services. During its 175-year history, our organization has grown tremendously in both scale and capabilities. Deloitte currently has approximately 415,000 people in more than 150 countries and territories, and serves four out of five Fortune Global 500® companies. Yet, our shared culture and mission—to make an impact that matters—remains unchanged. This is evident not only in Deloitte’s work for clients, but also in our WorldClass ambition, our WorldClimate initiative and our ALL IN diversity and inclusion strategy.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

**Are you ready for the next step in your career and to join our team in Sweden?**
  

 Deloitte's business area Technology & Transformation Nordic is a market leader and works together with decision-makers in both global and local organizations. We support organizations in their challenges regarding strategy issues and in the implementation of complex transformations that often include major business-driven IT changes.
   

  

  

  

**Cloud Strategy & Architecture Leader**
  

 The Swedish Engineering Leader for Cloud Strategy and Architecture is responsible for overseeing the strategic direction and operational management and growth of Deloitte Sweden’s Cloud Strategy & Architecture offering. This includes driving business growth, managing financial performance, and delivering high-quality cloud services to our clients. The role involves building and nurturing client relationships, supporting technology partnerships, identifying market opportunities, sales and developing go-to-market strategies. Additionally, it requires leading a team of cloud professionals, fostering a culture of innovation, working cross-Nordics to grow the cloud program, and leading client engagement.
   

  





  

  

 At Deloitte you will be part of a wider global network of highly skilled Cloud specialists and work in advisory projects together with consultants across our Deloitte network.
   

  

  

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

**We seek people with interest in Cloud technology and related architecture, in combination with the following qualifications:**



* You are working and living in Sweden
* A relevant university master’s degree, preferably in engineering or computer science and 15+ years’ work experience
* Proficiency in Swedish and English and strong communication skills
* Proven experience in leading and managing cloud business units, with an emphasis cross-border
* Strong understanding of cloud technologies and industry trends
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and relationship-building skills
* Strategic thinker with the ability to envision and implement growth strategies
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to grow a business


**Additional Information**

**What we offer**
  

 At Deloitte we focus on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths. By on-the-job learning experiences, formal development programs at Deloitte University and support from a personal coach, you will have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout your career. The way of working at Deloitte – our commitment to you.
   

  





**How to apply**
  

 Your application should consist of a CV and a cover letter and you apply directly online. Please apply as soon as possible as we will review the applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  





 As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut.
   

  





**Questions?**
  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Christine Cederberg, chrcederberg@deloitte.se. For questions regarding the application process, please contact Anna Taube, ataube@deloitte.se.
   

  





**We are looking forward to your application!**
  

  

  

 For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se
   

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Technical Account Manager, Google Cloud Consulting
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in a customer-facing role working with stakeholders, driving customer technical implementations or transformation programs.
* Experience supporting customers in cloud operations (e.g., launch or capacity planning, product release management), technical support, escalation management, or IT consulting.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* MBA or Master’s degree in a Management, Technical, or Engineering field.
* Experience translating business requirements into technological solutions.
* Experience in application or workload migration to public cloud providers.
* Experience collaborating with teams, groups, business units, channel partners, systems integrators, and third-party developers to deliver high-impact solutions.
* Understanding of IT operations, database systems, networking, IT security, application development, service architecture, cloud-native application development, hosted services, storage systems, or content delivery networks.
* Ability to communicate in English and Swedish fluently to support client relationship management in this region.


**About The Job**
 Our Google Cloud Consulting organization within Google Cloud delivers product and implementation expertise to our strategic customers to help them get the most out of their Google Cloud investments.
   

  

 As a Technical Account Manager (TAM), you will draw on your customer-facing skills and technical acumen to help customers successfully adopt Google Cloud products. Your previous experience with cloud infrastructure, program management, enterprise technology implementation, strategy development, and customer advocacy will play a critical part in your day-to-day work driving success at our most critical customers. You will lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud at leading organizations, guiding them through the strategic and technical facets of their Cloud transformation journey.
   

  

 In this role, you will drive customer adoption of Google Cloud services, like Google Compute Engine, Vertex AI, Google Kubernetes Engine, BigQuery, and many more. You will regularly engage with stakeholder groups, including executives of large enterprises and a cross-functional and geographically dispersed team. You will utilize relationship management skills and technical credibility to effectively communicate at all levels of the organization, establishing yourself as a trusted advisor.
   

  

 You will travel (domestically and internationally) up to approximately 20% of the time as needed.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Accelerate customer adoption of Google Cloud by leading the implementation journey. Provide technical guidance and manage timelines, milestones, migration goals, and business transformation strategies.
* Advocate for customer needs in order to overcome adoption blockers and drive new feature development. Lead across multiple workstreams and teams to maintain customer momentum.
* Develop relationships with stakeholders to understand customer’s business, develop strategic roadmaps, and lead quarterly business reviews and executive sessions to better understand business and technical needs.
* Plan for customer events and launches, partnering with support, engineers, and site reliability engineers to ensure customer success, and work with customers and support to guide issues/escalations to resolution.
* Develop best practices and assets based on learnings from customer engagements to support initiatives to scale through partners and accelerate Google Cloud adoption.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Data Engineer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 High salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 at Coody, you'll dive into technically exciting and intellectually challenging assignments to design and build fully automated data platforms and pipelines that creates real business value. Each assignment is 6–24 months and will give you both broadness and deepness from various industries and companies. As a consultant, you are expected to ramp up fast and deliver value from day one, often in new environments.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Data Engineer with at least 5+ years of experience** 
 . You must have a proven ability to get things done. Here’s what we’re seeking:
   

  

* Experience in designing, developing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, infrastructure, and tools.
* Professional experience with tools like Python, Snowflake, Airflow, DBT, Tableau, ELT/ETL, BigQuery, Looker Studio, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, SQL.
* A solid understanding of cloud environments; AWS / Google Cloud / Azure
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics (or similar)
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, temporary or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
*We’re looking for passionate, empathetic leaders who have experience both in hands-on coding and in leading teams. If you want to bring out the best in people while driving technical excellence, you’ll thrive in this role. We believe that leadership is about empowering others to grow, collaborating with your team, and leading by example.*
*At Nordnet, we encourage simplicity, inclusivity, and a just-do-it attitude, where every voice is heard, and all team members are empowered to contribute. If you’re driven to make an impact, build strong, diverse teams, and lead with technical expertise, we want to hear from you.*
**As An Engineering Manager, You Will**
* Lead and build collaborative and empowered teams, drawing on your hands-on technical expertise.
* Foster a supportive environment for growth and development, enabling your engineers to excel in both technical skills and leadership.
* Champion Nordnet's tech strategy, contributing to technical decision-making and ensuring we maintain technical excellence in all aspects of our team.
* Lead by example with your coding expertise, guiding your team through technical challenges and hands-on problem-solving.
* Contribute to the evolution of the engineering organization, fostering innovation and continuous learning.
* Collaborate closely with other Engineering Managers to share knowledge, solve challenges, and learn from each other.


**You And Your Skills**
* You have hands-on experience in software development and a strong technical background. You are comfortable reading code and when needed diving into technical discussions.
* You have experience leading and developing product development teams, empowering your engineers to grow in their roles.
* You are curious, open-minded, and always eager to learn, seeing challenges as opportunities to grow and improve.
* You lead with empathy, transparency, and trust, creating an environment where your team feels supported and motivated.
* You are a change leader, brave in pushing through friction and driving technical innovation.
* You hold a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.


**Culture At Nordnet Engineering**
* A just-do-it attitude, where everyone feels enabled and valued, regardless of their position or role.
* We live and breathe technology taking pride in our work.
* We take a scientific approach by experimenting and learning.
* We are curious and respectful, listen and ask questions with the intent to understand, while embracing different perspectives.
* We assume positive intent in others and foster a culture where speaking up and challenging ideas is welcomed.
* A commitment to work-life balance, ensuring flexibility and support for our employees’ well-being.


**This is us**
 At Nordnet, technology is at the core of everything we do, driving innovation and maintaining our competitive edge. As an Engineering Manager, you'll be at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge technology like Google Cloud Platform, React/React Native, and Java to shape our web and mobile experiences. We’ve made over 30 000 production releases this year, releasing our web every other hour and our app every two days.
   

  

 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

 In 1996, Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again with the aim of creating the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology.
   

  

 Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?
   

  

**Application**
 Apply today! – Please note that we only accept applications through our recruitment system. We do not consider email applications.
   

  

 If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Partner, Lovisa Malmberg, lovisa.malmberg@nordnet.se.
   

  

 At Nordnet, we value diversity and inclusion, and we are committed to creating an environment where everyone can succeed.
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Product Manager
description:
Over the past eight years we have provided smart tools that help put financial power back in the hands of the people – where we believe it belongs. Everything we do is based on one vision: to improve the financial health of our users - one credit at the time.
   

  

 So far, we’ve helped millions of users by refinancing expensive consumer loans. But we aim higher; new markets, new products and new ways of improving financial lives in an innovative way. As a Product Manager you will be responsible for our core offering joining a diverse scaleup environment with co-workers who are motivated, adaptable and committed to creating fantastic (we mean amazing) products.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 We believe that everyone should get the interest rate they deserve, meaning that assisting our users with debt management will always be at the core of what we do. You’ll play a key role in shaping our core product (refinancing) while helping to explore and build new fintech solutions that people truly need. Together with a team of engineers, designers and other specialists, you’ll drive projects forward with focus, speed and a clear sense of ownership.
   

  

**Your Work Will Cover Things Like**
* Turning user needs into product opportunities and features.
* Supporting strategy by connecting product outcomes to business goals.
* Using data and insights to make smart decisions and run experiments.
* Coordinating with your team to keep roadmaps realistic, transparent and on track.
* Communicating progress and learnings across the company.


**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for someone who can make complex things simple, and who enjoys working hands-on in a fast-moving environment. You don’t need to have led large product organizations – what matters is that you’ve worked closely with engineers and designers and know how to bring an idea from concept to launch.
   

  

**We Believe You’ll Bring**
* Around 3+ years of experience in product management (or equivalent).
* Experience in building and improving digital products (web and/or app).
* Knowledge of product methodologies, user research and roadmapping.
* A strong sense of urgency and the ability to prioritize what really matters.
* A curious, commercial mindset and interest in what drives customer engagement.


 Fintech experience is a plus but not a must – we’ll help you get up to speed. What counts most is your drive to learn, execute and grow with us.
   

  

 In short we are looking for a pragmatic product generalist with a mix of business development and doer mentality. If you are still reading this we hope that sounds like a good fit? So let's get to the good stuff…
   

  

**We offer you**
 The chance to be part of something truly amazing. We aspire for a level of ambition that matches the scale of our mission. If you're ready to be a part of this transformation we want to hear from you. If you have high grit, an unwavering sense of urgency, and an unyielding commitment to excellence, we want you to be the driving force behind reshaping the financial world. This isn't just a job; it's a mission.
   

  

 We promise that you will be challenged, pushed to develop your skill set and get the opportunity to work alongside amazing and smart colleagues. At Anyfin, we hire great people and create the conditions for them to have real autonomy and impact, especially in product management. While we've had a good run so far it is what lies ahead that excites everyone that works here, and we are just getting started. Then there is the compensation package, centrally located cozy office, extra time off on your birthday and a bunch of other benefits as well. But we will get to all that in due time.
   

  

 For now begin your journey with us by clicking "Apply" below.
   

  

 We cannot wait to meet you!
   

  

*PS Please note that we are unable to provide visa sponsorship for this role.*
 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Security Operations Lead
description:
The position can be based in either Stockholm or in Copenhagen.
   

  

*Are you ready to join a brand-new cyber security team where you’ll get the ownership of building and shaping Security operations services from the ground up? And do you see yourself in a role where your ideas shape technical delivery and operational excellence of our cyber security services? If so, join GlobalConnect - one of Northern Europe’s leading connectivity providers - and help launch our security operations services for our clients across Nordic markets.*
**About The Role And The Team**
 As our Security Operations Lead, you will take end-to-end ownership of our Security Operations services development and delivery, including Managed Detection & Response (MDR), Incident Response, and Security Consulting.
   

  

 You will play a central role in building a new SOC capability, setting standards, developing services, and supporting customers in strengthening their security operations. The role combines leadership, hands-on expertise, and close collaboration with colleagues across sales, product, and delivery.
   

  

 You’ll be trusted to make decisions, improve how we work, and help shape the future of cyber security services at GlobalConnect.
   

  

 The cyber security team will be part of the security services unit responsible for security products and services in GlobalConnect’s B2B business unit. Our unit has the sole focus of enabling our customers to secure their infrastructure. You will be part of a cross-Nordic organization with international customers.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Drive technical security initiatives and take the lead in establishing a modern and professional SOC department
* Own the technical delivery and operational quality of all Security Operations service offerings
* Delivery of cyber security consultancy, advisory and professional services to GlobalConnect customers
* Guide and mentor security specialists, supporting their professional growth and operational maturity
* Support pre-sales and sales as a technical subject matter expert, including scoping of requirement, contribute to proposals, and engage with customers as a senior, trusted advisor around their security operations, guiding them on detection, response and operational cyber security maturity.


**Why you should join GlobalConnect?**
 Joining GlobalConnect means becoming part of a company that's not just talking about change but actively leading it. You’ll join a diverse, inclusive team across the Nordics, working with talented colleagues who push boundaries and deliver measurable results. We offer a hybrid working environment that gives you flexibility while keeping you connected to your team and customers. Here you’ll get the rare chance to build a high-impact security service from scratch, influence product direction, and grow a team within an established, fast-scaling technology provider.
   

  

**To Succeed In This Role, We Believe You Have**
 7+ years of relevant technical cyber security and lead experience, practical knowledge covering following areas:
   

  

* Working in security operations like security monitoring and security incident response, preferably in a lead role and in a customer-facing organization
* Designing layered protection, detection and response with relevant security technologies for modern end-user environment (e.g. endpoint, identity, email, network)
* Standardizing and continuously improving the quality of operations. Working with customers and sales teams
* Proficient in English and fluent in one Nordic language (Swedish, Norwegian or Danish) - able to communicate clearly with customers and colleagues in both written and spoken form.
* Due to the nature of the role, the position requires the ability to obtain and maintain security clearance in accordance with GlobalConnect's policies and applicable laws and regulations.


 At GlobalConnect, you’ll have the chance to make a significant impact on day one. If you're ready to take on a role where your contributions will be valued and your success will be celebrated, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 If you’re excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, don’t worry! We’d still love to hear from you.
   

  

 No need for a personal letter – just send us your CV or LinkedIn profile. Join us, and be part of the transformation. Apply today!
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Implementation Specialist - Netherlands
description:
**About Intric**
 Intric is accelerating its growth, backed by new funding and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform, Intric.ai, is transforming how work gets done – particularly within the public sector and among organizations that prioritize data sovereignty. We make advanced AI accessible, secure, and practical. Today, we hold a market-leading position within our niche, and we are continuing to scale across Europe.
   

  

 We are now looking for an Implementation Specialist who wants to be part of building something meaningful from the ground up.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an Implementation Specialist, you play a critical role in ensuring our customers succeed with Intric. You are the bridge between our platform and the organizations that rely on it.
   

  

 Your focus is not only on understanding customer needs, but on translating those needs into real, value-creating implementations. You educate, guide, and inspire users to adopt AI in ways that meaningfully improve their daily work.
   

  

 This is a hands-on role where you work closely with customers, internal teams, and subject-matter experts to ensure smooth onboarding, strong engagement, and long-term success.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Lead customer onboarding and implementation projects from start to finish
* Educate and inspire users on how to leverage the platform effectively
* Analyze customer workflows and identify opportunities where AI can create efficiency and impact
* Facilitate seamless integration of Intric into day-to-day operations
* Collaborate with customer stakeholders and internal product teams to ensure successful outcomes
* Drive engagement and long-term adoption by building strong, trust-based relationships


 Who You Are
   

  

 You are someone who enjoys working closely with people while understanding systems and processes at a deeper level.
   

  

 You:
   

  

* Communicate complex ideas clearly and persuasively
* Have a service-oriented and pedagogical mindset
* Learn new technology quickly and feel comfortable navigating digital tools
* Are curious about how organizations operate and enjoy understanding workflows
* Thrive in collaborative environments and work well with experts across different domains
* Take ownership and proactively drive projects forward


**Must-Haves**
* Strong communication skills in English and Dutch, both written and verbal
* Experience working with customers in a consultative or implementation-focused role
* Ability to understand and map business processes
* High level of structure, ownership, and follow-through
* Genuine interest in AI and how technology can improve real-world operations


**Why Join Intric**
* Rapid career development in a fast-moving sector
* Competitive compensation package including salary and stock options
* Ownership and influence: bring your ideas to life
* Be part of a visionary team shaping the future of AI in Europe


**Practical Information**
 Location: Primarily remote with occasional travel to the local office or regional hubs
   

  

 Travel: Regular travel within the Netherlands and occasional cross-market collaboration
   

  

**Benefits**
* Competitive salary and stock options
* 25 days of paid vacation
* Wellness allowance
* Rapid career development in a fast-growing AI company


 Culture at Intric
   

  

 At Intric, we are building secure AI solutions for organizations that truly matter. We work with governments and enterprises where quality, responsibility, and trust are non-negotiable.
   

  

 We value ownership, high standards, and thoughtful execution. Titles matter less than contribution. If you see something that can be improved, you take initiative. If something is unclear, you ask questions. If a customer faces a challenge, you lean in.
   

  

 We combine ambition with collaboration. We move fast, but we care deeply about doing things right. As we continue scaling across Europe, every team member plays a meaningful role in shaping both the company and the culture.

title: (Senior) Data Scientist
description:
**Empowering Instabee's Logistics Through Production-Grade Predictive Modeling**
**About The Role 🚀**
 The Instabee Predictions team is at the heart of optimizing our logistics and operations. We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated (Senior) Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer to join our small but critical team.
   

  

**This role can be based in either our Oslo or Stockholm office** 
 , depending on where you are located. You will follow an end-to-end approach, taking complex data problems from raw input to direct business impact. This role is essential for replacing a crucial team member, ensuring we maintain our ability to leverage production-grade ML models and advanced predictive techniques to inform critical decision-making across the organization.
   

  

**❗️Clarification: ML Engineering Focus**
**This is a highly technical role focused on developing and deploying production-ready Machine Learning models.** 
 If your primary background is in Business Intelligence (BI), ETL development, or Data Platform architecture, this is likely
 **not** 
 the right fit. Your core responsibility will be the
 **design, development, and deployment of complex ML models** 
 that solve sophisticated logistical and operational challenges.
   

  

**What You Will Do (Responsibilities) 🎯**
* Build Production-Grade ML Solutions: Architect, develop, validate, and deploy end-to-end Machine Learning models into our production environment to generate reliable, real-time forecasts.
* Data-Driven Model Development: Conduct sophisticated data analysis and feature engineering as the foundation for your ML model development, ensuring models are robust and performant.
* Deliver Strategic Insights: Interpret model results and translate them into invaluable, actionable insights for stakeholders in areas such as route planning, resource scheduling, and personnel planning.


**What You Will Bring (Requirements) ✅**
 We are looking for a candidate with proven experience in Machine Learning Engineering:
   

  

* ML Engineering Expertise: Strong background in Machine Learning Engineering or advanced Data Science, with proven experience building models in a production setting (e.g., using MLOps practices, Python, and relevant ML frameworks).
* Advanced Predictive Modeling: Deep understanding and hands-on experience in building and validating complex statistical/ML models with direct business impact, going beyond standard linear methods.
* Full End-to-End Ownership: Ability to take a complex business problem and drive it through the entire ML lifecycle—from data exploration and model development to deployment and monitoring.


 If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

 Why Join Instabee? ⭐
   

  

 The Predictions team is critical to Instabee's operational success. Your work will directly influence strategic decisions, optimize operations, and drive overall business success.
   

  

* Highest Impact: Be the driving force behind reliable forecasts that directly inform fundamental business areas like route planning and resource scheduling.
* Collaborative Environment: Join a small, expert team tackling complex, high-value data challenges.


 What you’ll get
   

  

 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

 🌇 Modern and newly renovated offices located in both Oslo and Stockholm
   

  

 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day
   

  

 🍻 Social agenda including afterworks, sports & other fun activities
   

  

 💰 Good pension scheme and premium health insurance
   

  

 🥗
 **Catered delicious food** 
 in the office 5 days per week (Oslo) / Great lunch options (Stockholm)
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get to know us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
*Vi tror att framsteg och möjligheter skapas bäst tillsammans. Välkommen till en plats där samarbete gör skillnad.*
 Hos Saab blir du en del av ett nyskapande team som utvecklar och driftar en modern, affärskritisk plattform för att framtidssäkra vår verksamhet.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som Site Reliability Engineer inom Group-IT arbetar du nära både utvecklings- och plattformsteam i ett tekniskt initiativ där du har stort utrymme att påverka hur lösningar byggs, automatiseras och förbättras. Rollen kombinerar utveckling, drift och säkerhet, med fokus på stabilitet, prestanda och smart automation.
   

  

 Vi arbetar främst remote med virtuella samarbetsverktyg och parprogrammering, och ses fysiskt 2–3 sammanhängande dagar per kvartal. Du har även möjlighet att arbeta från en Saab-hub på någon av våra orter runt om i landet, antingen i Stockholm, Linköping, Malmö eller Göteborg.
   

  

**Det här kommer du att göra**
* Säkerställa hög tillgänglighet genom monitoring, observability och proaktiv felsökning
* Automatisera infrastruktur och deployments med moderna verktyg och arbetssätt
* Arbeta med incidenthantering, kapacitetsplanering och kontinuerliga förbättringar
* Vara med och forma säkra, skalbara lösningar i linje med DevSecOps


 Här får du arbeta i ett team som värdesätter kreativitet, tekniskt djup och samarbete och där du får vara med och bygga lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Du har några års erfarenhet (cirka 3+ år) av plattforms-, cloud- eller DevOps-nära arbete och ett starkt intresse för tillförlitliga system. Du är nyfiken, självgående och trivs i miljöer där det finns frihet att tänka nytt och ta ansvar.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**
* Erfarenhet av cloud- och plattformsteknik, inklusive virtualisering, containerisering och orkestrering, gärna i privata molnmiljöer
* Vana av automation och scripting, exempelvis Python, Bash, Terraform eller Ansible
* Erfarenhet av monitoring- och larmverktyg som Prometheus, Grafana eller liknande
* Stark förmåga att felsöka och lösa komplexa tekniska problem


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av Kubernetes och containerorkestrering
* God förståelse för DevOps- och DevSecOps-principer
* Bidrag till open source-projekt


 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Vad du blir en del av**
 Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.

title: Senior Projektledare
description:
**Professional Galaxy** 
 är ett IT- och teknikkonsultbolag som tillhandahåller högspecialiserad kompetens inom IT, mjukvaruutveckling, SAP, inköp, elektronik och mekanisk konstruktion. Vi samarbetar med erfarna seniora experter och levererar strategiskt värdeskapande kompetens till några av Sveriges mest komplexa och analytiskt krävande projekt. Vårt fokus ligger alltid på hög kvalitet, professionalism och tydliga, mätbara resultat.
   

  

 Är du rätt person för uppdraget, eller vill du rekommendera en stark kandidat? Tveka inte att kontakta oss.
   

  

 Ansök gärna redan idag, urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en
 **Senior Projektledare, nivå 4** 
 hos vår kund.
   

  

**Om uppdraget**
**Roll:**
* Leda och samordna projektteam
* Engagera samt inspirera teamen att nå gemensamma mål
* Planera, organisera och följa upp projektets alla faser - från initiering till avslut
* Rapportera tydlig status för projektet till styrgrupp och övriga intressenter
* Kommunicera tydligt med interna och externa intressenter
* Säkerställa förutsättningar och jobbar proaktivt med att undanröja hinder
* Identifiera, mitigera och rapportera risker
* Dokumentera och strukturera viktiga beslut och åtgärder
* Skapa relationer och bygga förtroende
* Leda styrgruppsmöten och begära rätt stöd vid rätt tid
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet i ledande roller


 Uppdraget omfattas av försvarssekretess, vilket innebär krav på svenskt medborgarskap och godkännande av säkerhetsprövning utförd av myndighet.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 2026-02-24
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.

title: Business Development  Manager - EMEA
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The role**
 We are seeking a high-impact
 **Business Development Manager** 
 to lead our EMEA sales organisation through its next phase of growth. This is a first-line leadership position, reporting to the Global Head of Inside Sales. You will be leading a growing team of BDRs currently based in Stockholm. You’ll be responsible for scaling a high-performing BDR organisation, coaching reps into world-class BDRs and driving consistent execution across the region.
   

  

 You’ll own pipeline generation, talent development, and scalable processes — while also representing as the top of funnel leader in Stockholm.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
*Leadership & Talent Development*
* Manage and coach BDRs, developing them into world-class reps.
* Build a culture of accountability, collaboration, and excellence.
* Recruit, onboard, and retain top sales talent across the region


*Pipeline Management*
* Own EMEA Pipeline targets with accurate forecasting
* Run pipeline reviews to ensure quality, velocity, and disciplined execution


*Process & Execution*
* Define and enforce scalable sales processes that drive efficiency
* Partner with RevOps and Marketing on systems, metrics, and dashboards to enable performance
* Champion operational excellence in driving high quality pipeline generation and ensuring team is hitting KPIs


*Key Results & Metrics*
* Success in this role will be measured by performance against key metrics, including:
* Overall EMEA Sales Qualified Lead (SQL) and pipeline generation target
* BDR ramp-up and time-to-productivity
* Meeting quality scores and conversion rates to Sales Accepted Opportunities (SAO)


*Communication & Collaboration*
* Act as the voice of the EMEA BDR organisation internally.
* Partner closely with Marketing, Product, Enablement and GTM to align GTM strategy.


**We’re Looking For**
* 2+ years in B2B SaaS sales leadership
* Proven track record of scaling high-performing teams across EMEA.
* Strong ability to recruit, coach, and retain A+ sales talent.
* Experience with strategic alignment and GTM strategy
* Operational excellence in KPI tracking, performance insights, pipeline management, forecasting, and structured execution
* Executive presence with credibility to engage senior stakeholders externally and internally.
* A growth mindset: comfortable with ambiguity, fast-moving environments, and cross-functional collaboration.


**What's In It For You**
* The opportunity to launch your GTM career at a legal AI company with true product–market fit.
* Direct exposure to senior sales leadership and the chance to learn by doing: fast.
* Structured onboarding, regular coaching, and clear paths for growth.
* A fast-moving environment where your insights shape how we scale.
* Competitive base salary, uncapped variable compensation, and equity upside.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Account Manager
description:
**Join Our Scaleup Journey & Fuel Your Curiosity!**
 At Lime Go, a thriving scaleup under Lime Technologies Sweden AB (publ), you’ll be part of a fast-moving, entrepreneurial team with the backing of a successful, publicly listed company. It's the best of both worlds – the agility of a startup and the stability of an industry leader with a proven track record of success.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
* A curiosity-driven, growth-oriented mindset ready to scale with us
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
* Sharp problem-solving abilities


**Your Role in Our Team**
* Own the entire sales process, from prospecting to closing and handover
* Target ideal customers across industries and regions
* Get creative with omnichannel outreach and inbound leads to build your pipeline
* Tailor our Data-driven Sales CRM to fit each customer’s needs – demo both online and in-person
* Negotiate to win larger deals faster, smashing your sales goals in the process


**The Product**
 Lime Go is a Data-Enriched Sales CRM built for SMBs in the Nordics. You’ll be selling to sales teams who understand the value of what we offer. With over 1,000 customers in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark, our aim is to become the top choice for ambitious companies across Europe.
   

  

 We’ve just completed a full product revamp, making Lime Go a fresh, modern, and powerful tool for your customers.
   

  

**The Lime Go Team**
 We’re a close-knit, ambitious team of 24 with bold growth goals for the coming years. We’re looking for a cornerstone player like you to help make it happen.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements** 
**Requirements**
* B2B sales experience, preferably 1+ years of selling complex products/services (bonus if SaaS!)
* Bachelor’s degree
* Driver's license
* Willing to work from our office in Stockholm
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* A proven track record of sales excellence


 You’ll report to Jonas (Sales Manager) and have weekly 1-on-1s, plus collaborate with our 11-member Revenue Operations team (Sales, CS, Product - all in Stockholm!).
   

  

**Perks & Benefits**
* Competitive base salary with performance-based commissions (with kicker levels!)
* 6 weeks of vacation, company conferences and parties, wellness allowance, pension, and more
* A fun, collaborative environment with regular team activities and laughs


**The Application Process**
* Screening call with the team
* Interview
* Case assignment to pitch our product
* In-depth interview(s) with team members
* Reference check
* Agreement walkthrough
* Final interview with Lime Group’s CEO and/or Business Unit Director.


 Don’t wait – apply now and start your journey with us. Europe is ready for Lime Go. Are you?
   

  

 Let’s Go! 🚀

title: Lead Auditor - Information Security ISO 27001
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Business Assurance**
 We help companies ensure compliance, build high-performing management systems, and meet competence needs within a wide range of industries. DNV helps companies understand Working with us, you can be involved in technically challenging and innovative projects worldwide demanding a broad variety of expertise. Our strong focus on research and innovation opens an array of opportunities, and allows you to engage in projects which develop next generation solutions. and manage their risk picture through our management system certification and training portfolios.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a result of further growth of our Business Assurance Unit in Sweden we are looking for qualified
 **Lead Auditors** 
 within the
 **Information Security ISO 27001** 
 area, preferably combined with ISO 9001.
